Name: Pytaki
Description:
Game PYTAKI is a nice, simple integration game for the whole family. Thanks to intuitive mechanics, you can start playing PYTAKI right away. This is important because many people do not like playing games because of their complicated rules. It's enough that only one person reads the instruction beforehand and is able to bring the whole family into play in a minute.

Game Play:
On your turn you draw a task tile requiring you to answer personal question or perform specific task. Tasks may involve additional components like Mood dice (for example you roll them and then tell what makes you feel the mood rolled). Play continues until the stack of tiles is exhausted. There is no winner per se.

Polish edition of Pytaki sold more than 10000 copies.

---

Gra PYTAKI jest przyjemnÄ…, prostÄ… grÄ… integracyjnÄ… dla caÅ‚ej rodziny. DziÄ™ki intuicyjnej mechanice, w PYTAKI moÅ¼na zaczÄ…Ä‡ graÄ‡ wÅ‚aÅ›ciwie od razu. To waÅ¼ne, poniewaÅ¼ wiele osób nie lubi graÄ‡ w gry ze wzglÄ™du na ich skomplikowane zasady. Wystarczy, Å¼e tylko jedna osoba przeczyta wczeÅ›niej instrukcjÄ™ i jest w stanie wprowadziÄ‡ w rozgrywkÄ™ caÅ‚Ä… rodzinÄ™ w ciÄ…gu minuty.

Rozgrywka polega na tym, Å¼e gracze siadajÄ… razem i po kolei (lub wedÅ‚ug innego z proponowanych kluczy) losujÄ… z woreczka "PYTAKI" czyli Å¼etony, a nastÄ™pnie odpowiadajÄ… na wylosowane pytanie lub wykonujÄ… zadanie.

Pytania dotyczÄ… róÅ¼nych dziedzin Å¼ycia a refleksja nad nimi i sÅ‚uchanie odpowiedzi innych zapewniajÄ… graczom:

Lepsze poznanie siÄ™
Rozwój samoÅ›wiadomoÅ›ci emocjonalnej
Ä†wiczenie komunikacji (sÅ‚uchania, opowiadania)
KsztaÅ‚towanie postaw empatycznych
Ä†wiczenie cierpliwoÅ›ci
Wspieranie nauki czytania najmÅ‚odszych

Name: Monster Rock
Description:
Tales of adventurers, treasures and dragons are now a distant memory for the citizens of Paradise City. Those who were enemies are now friends and the world has moved on, even though pockets of magic remain. And there is a new form of entertainment – Rock and Roll!

King Richard, son of Nicholas the Good, has never really liked people. His paranoia has grown worse over the years and he is building an army of robots to subjugate the good citizens of Paradise City. Only the people can stop the mad king, but they need inspiration to do so. You must lead your band, with your revolutionary rock songs and unite the various folks of the city. Only together can you take down the ‘Man’. But beware, the king’s secret police are everywhere and take a dim view of long hair and loud music. Make yourself too obvious and you will end up in a dank dungeon.

Monster Rock is a rollicking game of fun and adventure set in a modern fantasy world. You need to improve your band by playing gigs and writing songs. There are different audiences with varying tastes. The Halflings are simple folk and a popular ditty is all they need to entertain them, while the Elves are far more sophisticated and respect a well-crafted melody. Or you can play to the Undead and crank your amps up to eleven! Your fans become your followers, whom you can then lead in the revolution against King Richard and his robot army.

Monster Rock can be played by up to five music fans, competitively or cooperatively. There is also a solo mode.

Name: Might and Magic: Duel of Champions PnP
Description:
Duel of Champions is strategy card game set in the fantastic Might and Magic universe, where six factions fight for power. The game goal is to bring your opponent's life total to 0. You do so by deploying Creatures, Buildings, casting Spells or using Fortunes and Events in your favor. You also need to choose a hero - champion that will lead your army into battle. Each hero offers different playstyle, so choose wisely. Game is turn based.

—description from the designer

Name: Räkna riddare
Description:
This very simple subtraction math game is called Räkna riddare ("Count Knights") on the box and "Minusleken" ("The Minus Game") in the rules.

Players are dealt a number of cards which come in two types, subtraction questions (e.g. "9-2" or "6-4") and results numbered 0-8. One player states a question from one of their cards, and the other players should call out the correct answer providing they hold a corresponding card. The rules contradict themselves on the subject of drawing cards and hand sizes, but basically you keep matching pairs and drawing. The rules are also inconsistent between languages when to end the game: either when all cards have been drawn, or until no more matches can be made between hands. At this point matching pairs in hand are added to pairs taken during play and the player with the most pairs wins.

—user summary

Name: King Cat
Description:
You will gain control of 1 of 4 unique Cat Kingdoms seeking dominance of your the home. Control your stores of Catnip, Recruit Knight Cats, Fulfill Secret Royal Decrees, Raise your Kingdom's Instinct, Honor, and use your cat army to conquer Territory, Toys, and Food for command of Victory Points.

The Kingdom with the most victory points wins!

This game combines hand and resource management, set collection, and competitive and cooperative play.

Tremendous replay value and family fun appeal with colorful components and a cute theme parodying the lives of our furry cat friends.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gone Flippin'
Description:
In this FREE print & play, you can live the dream of being a Flip the Table panelist and play cheesy, weird, and obscure board games in your quest to be the first to score 10,000 POINTS! On your turn, you might buy cheesy games at Flip's Thrift shop! Or risk all your hard-earned quarters at The Professor's Lazer Arcade! Or possibly go to Jared's Wrestling Academy and fight for the world title! Or even use Chris's Editing Bay to manipulate time and space! Play the games and get the points, but until you sell them when you pass go, the points might be taken from you!  And as always, beware of Soviet Russia...because in Soviet Russia, TABLE FLIPS YOU!

And did we mention it's a roll-and-move game? SURPRISE!!!

Name: Scoville: 2018 Dice Tower Recipe Cards
Description:
This is a set of 10 new recipe cards given out for supporting certain tiers of the 2018 Dice Tower Kickstarter fundraiser.

These cards are added to the recipe cards in the base game for extra variety and chosen at random per the usual rules.

Name: Chomp-itz Crocodile Dinner
Description: Each of the two or three players in Chomp-itz Crocodile Dinner straps an elongated crocodile snout to their face, then races to catch their four colored fish so that they can then snatch the gold fish to win the game!

Name: Punk Rock Book Tour: The Boardgame
Description:
Live the adventurous life of a publisher on the road! Meet fans, discover rare books, get peed on by cats! Just make sure you can scrape up enough gas money to get to the next city or it's game over, man, game over.

In Punk Rock Book Tour: The Boardgame, you go on a book tour with limited supplies. The player with the best haircut goes first. Drive the biofuel truck to PICK UP WASTE GREASE. Drive the waste grease to the PROCESSING CENTER to make fuel. Then drive to YOUR EVENT and on to the next city. If you run out of fuel, you move only one space. When the first player has completed three cities, the player with the most fuel wins. However, the player who has the most fun is the "real winner."

—description from the publisher

Name: Host Your Own Race Night
Description:
Part of Cheatwell Games series of 'Host Your Own' games. This version contains 100, 500, and 1000 notes which players use to bet on the outcome of races. The game contains a wipe clean board and temporary marker to go with a bookmakers ledger.
The races themselves consist of clips of Greyhounds on a DVD accompanying the game which are played to give the results.

Name: Tactician: the Game of Battlefield Strategy
Description:
Tactician is a two-player turn-based game of tactics and strategy in which the players are medieval generals. Each player commands an army of Archers, Pikemen, Mounted Archers, and Knights who fight to destroy the foe and win the day.

Players first choose which advanced tactics to use, if any, and then assemble the game board. Choose at least four of the fourteen square tiles and arrange them so all tiles are accessible and both players have an equal number of starting squares. For a challenge, use the Tactical Terrain side of the tiles.

Each player begins with between eight and twenty units of their choosing, deployed within the first three rows of their side of the board. Turn phases include Movement, Combat, and Resupply. Combat is resolved based on Unit Advantages, situational bonuses, and a roll of the dice. All phases are completed by a single player before their opponent may begin their turn.

In order to win, one player must eliminate all enemy forces from the field or outnumber their opponent's troops by more than 3-to-1. Set-up and play average 60 minutes total.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rabble
Description:
Our favorite memories are the ones with good friends, hilarious jokes, and when things got a little weird. We created Rabble to spark more of those unforgettable nights.

Get your friends to guess your team’s Rabble Cards as quickly as possible. Each round uses the same cards but has different restrictions on how to give clues. Play Challenge Cards to slow down the other team by making them do ridiculous challenges.

Each game is made with environmentally sustainable, FSC-certified paper

We feature guest illustrations from independent artists

4-20+ players | Ages 17+ | 30-40 min

—description from the publisher

Based on the public domain game known as Celebrities.

Name: Speed Farkel
Description: Speed Farkel is a fast, six-player version of the popular game, Pocket Farkel, in that the scoring combinations are the same.  However, all players start with zero score and all players roll every turn at the same time.  Players scramble to try to roll a minimum score that has been determined by rolling the 12-sided "IGNITION" die.  The scorekeeper records and adds all scores after every round.  The first player to get over 10,000 points is the winner.

Name: Dead 'til Dawn
Description:
Dead 'til Dawn is a zombie group survival game for 3 to 8 players, where you don't actually need to survive to win! In each game, you will experience a unique zombie apocalypse story line with your friends full of choices, voting, alliances, combat, and betrayals. The game plays out like a group choose-your-own-adventure, only when players die they aren't out of the game - they become zombies with their own "zombie cravings" that they need to satisfy to win! Dead 'til Dawn is a unique, action packed and exciting game!

Dead 'til Dawn Mixes Role Play with a Competitive Twist. Each player starts with a Character card, with unique abilities and/or agendas, though it's still up to the player to decide how to play! The game starts by revealing 8 yellow-bannered character cards. These are the “core characters” who will allow new players to ease into the game. Some characters are helpful, some selfish, and some are downright evil. If a Character dies and joins the moaning dead, the bottom half of their Character card will show how they can still win by satisfying a “zombie craving."

Dead 'til Dawn plays out like a Zombie Movie. As the night falls, the survivors are hopeful - they have weapons, equipment, they're unhurt and ready to face the night. However, about half way through the game, as ammo runs low and weapons and tools have been broken or lost, and people's agendas begin to show...

Every game is a unique zombie story line. With 104 Event cards (or 120 with the deluxe set), 12 Setting cards (from the Dead Arm of the Law expansion), AND up to 25 possible Characters, this game never plays the same way twice.

Finally, players are NEVER out of the game. If a player dies, they simply switch sides and continue to play as a zombie! They draw zombie cards to achieve their "zombie craving," which usually features taking down those left alive. This feature not only keeps everyone involved, but as the game progresses and more players become zombies, it greatly increases the difficulty and drama of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Timun Mas and Green Giants
Description:
Once upon a time, lived a green giant named Buto Ijo. He gave a cucumber seed to old woman. Later on, the seed growth into giant cucumber. When the cucumber was slice, a cute baby appeared. The baby was named Timun Mas. 8 years later, Green Giant was back to take Timun mas as his food.

You play as Timun Mas. Bringing 4 magical weapons, you have to beat down the Green Giant. What are the weapons? Cucumber seed, salt, terasi, and needle. Collect all this weapons and attack the Green Giant.

Each player  plays as Timun mas. You are the winner if you are able to collect Greent Giant greater than others.

Name: The Heritage of Batik
Description:
Batik is known as heritage of Indonesia’s culture. Therefore, we should keep it since it’s very sublime. Throughout this board game, we can play together with our family or friends. This game uses an unique local theme without losing its essence or its philosophy.

Player should collect component cards in order to create a Batik tile. Every single Batik tile is placed next to other tile so that it’s connected and create a pattern. Every time player buy a tile or use a tile, s/he will get a victory point. Moreover, player also has a chance to switch variate spell cards. By using this cards, player can distract another player or even speed up the action to get highest point. Player with highest point will be the champion.

Name: Heavy Gear Demo Game
Description:
An Introduction to the Heavy Gear World
This introductory game contains a simplified version of the Heavy Gear rules that keeps all the flavor of the game, but is easier to learn and faster to play. It does not require the use of the rulebook or of ANY other regular Heavy Gear supplements. The Heavy Gear Game demo includes 8 cut-out Gear counters (4 Hunters, 4 Jägers), 1 color hex map and a condensed version of the Silhouette tactical rules. All you need are a few six-sided dice.

—description from the introduction

Name: Death Struggle:  Barbarossa 1941
Description:
"Death Struggle: Barbarossa 1941" is a Brigade to Division to Corps/Army level wargame with many pieces but incentive to create the (much fewer) higher level units to speed gameplay.  24 miles per hex - 30 hexes from Warsaw to Moscow.  15 half-month turns, IIJun41-IIJan42, enabling the Russian Winter counteroffensive.  Includes a breakthrough/Blitzkrieg second, Tactical movement and Combat result.

Has Air units and simplified/abstracted Airwar rules.

Introductory subgames for Leningrad, Moscow, and (a little one we have played the heck out of) Rostov.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: One Piece: Water 7
Description:
In this new cooperative board game Luffy and his crew arrive in Water 7, the famous island-city with its seven naval shipyards. They soon realize that their boat, the Going Merry, is not reparable! They will have to find material in order to build a new one. But the CP9 will do everything to stop their progress and have kidnapped Robin. Will they be able to save their friend, build the Thousand Sunny and board it before the Aqua Laguna, a gigantic wave, invades the game?

From the hit manga and anime, One Piece.
An official TOEI Animation product ensuring quality and authenticity
Instructions available in Spanish, German, Italian and French.

On your turn you roll and reroll your progress dice to use them to get victory points, resources and move around the board, trying to get the pieces to build the new ship and to rescue Nico Robin. If you can not avoid the CP9 enemies, you will fight using combat dices and your resources against them.

The enemy figures are moved by an event deck of cards, and after some turns, the Aqua Laguna waves will start to invade the board. You and your team must be quick! If you are covered by the Aqua Laguna water, you can be eliminated. And if the water invades everything (all Aqua Laguna counters are used), all of you will lose.

However, if you finish the ship and rescue Nico Robin in time, the  player with most victory points will be the real winner!

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Arcane Portal
Description:
The demonic portal is opening...

From the depths of the abyss, new, infernal enemies are summoned to bring chaos and death to the Talon Coast! Create new legendary tales by fighting and banishing them to save the realm. In Sword & Sorcery: Arcane Portal, the heroes' path brings them to the slopes of the majestic and imposing Thunder Mountains. Drawn by whisperings of a cult trying to end the world, the heroes are challenged by a shadow of nameless fears.

Continue the epic campaign you started in Sword & Sorcery with the perilous quests of this expansion, which introduces new, dreadful enemies especially designed to interact with each other to defeat any hero who dares to cross their path!

Name: Escape the Dark Castle: Adventure Pack 1 – Cult of the Death Knight
Description:
Welcome prisoner, to a new era of The Dark Castle. The Death Knight has risen to prominence, his dark cult bringing new danger to the castle, his deadly curses plaguing those who seek to escape...

Cult of the Death Knight is an expansion pack for Escape the Dark Castle, introducing new rules and content to expand and deepen your adventures. Along with a new boss, chapters and curse cards, this pack introduces 3 new playable characters: the Bishop, Hunter, and Mason. The new prisoners are all specialists in one particular area: The Mason’s might knows no bounds, the Hunter can be counted on for cunning, and the Bishop is well-known for his wisdom.

Expansion includes:

3 New Characters & their Custom Dice - each a powerful specialist  
15 New Chapter Cards – taking you to new areas of The Dark Castle 
1 New Boss Card – the Death Knight himself, Lord of Decay
3 New Item Cards – Introducing Curses, terrible afflictions to thwart your progress
1 Custom Cultist Dice – Pray you won't need to roll it

Name: Supervillain
Description:
Supervillain is a card & dice game where players, branded Villains by the corrupted Establishment, compete to expose the perverting influences on our institutions and governments; its up to YOU to expose the corruption!

Using Characters and Items to claim Capers, Villains put a spotlight on corruption - spreading information like modern-day Robin Hoods.

The Villain who Claims the most Caper points is crowned the Supervillain!

Compete to solve Capers and interfere with other Villains' plans using Shenanigans cards. Combat can ensue, as the Villain to your left may block your attempted Caper.

Villains play Character & Item cards with values that represent the number of dice they roll to solve that portion of the Caper; the Villain to your left rolls the number of dice on the Caper to "set the point" to match or beat.

Game length is adjustable depending on how many Capers players agree to play for at the beginning of the game, usually from 30-60 minutes. Solo play time is typically 20-30 minutes.

Each game comes with 54 high-quality, non-toxic cards made in the USA (8 Chessex dice - from the UK - included).

—description from the publisher

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: 2017 SlugCrew Minor Reward
Description:
Adds 3 drinks to the drink deck

Alchemist's Artisanal Ale (this one also appears in The Red Dragon Inn: Allies â€“ Evil Pooky)
Drowsy Poison
Wrench’s Alc-O-Matic

Name: Dites-le en langue des signes ! Le jeu
Description:
Card game to learn French sign language.
Players have cards in their hands, they are mainly cards with a word and a drawing of its translation in sign language, but there is also action cards for attack and defense. At their turn, a player plays up to 3 cards. A “sign” card is played as a challenge to an another player: the one playing the card
says the word, or makes the sign, and the other one has to translate. The player winning the challenge wins the card, and the first player to 10 cards wins the game.

Le jeu contient 100 cartes et s’utilise avec l’application Elix. Il permet de découvrir 50 signes de base de la langue des signes Française (LSF).
À chaque tour, lancez des défis « signes » aux autres joueurs et devenez incollable sur la LSF !
Le jeu s’adresse à tous les curieux de la langue des signes et favorise l’ouverture vers la communauté sourde.
Surprenez votre famille, vos amis ou collègues avec ce jeu et développez une autre façon de communiquer ensemble.

Name: 赤の国 青の国 (Red Kingdom & Blue Kingdom)
Description:
There was a red nation and a blue nation in one land. You are the king of one of these nations. The land has five bases, including the castles of each nation. To win the game, you must occupy all five bases or defeat the enemy king. Use your soldiers to grab these bases!

Gameplay in èµ¤ã®å›½ é’ã®å›½ (Red Nation Blue Nation) alternates in turns. On a turn, a player draws cards based on the bases they hold up to a maximum hand size of five cards. You can dispatch a soldier from your hand onto a base, with the sword showing your attack value against the shield's defense value in the base.

Name: Moscow In Peril:  1941
Description:
Russian tank brigade up to army level.  3 turns per month - Oct-Jan - for a total of 12 turns, enabling the Russian winter counteroffensive.  16 hexes Smolensk to Moscow - 15 miles per hex.  Blitzkrieg/breakthrough attacks.

Roads as well as railroads mapped.

—description from the designer

Name: Salt and Pepper
Description:
Get ready to add some spice to your game night with Spicy Games! Each of the spice bottles hold all of the pieces you need to play a game. Each game takes 2 minutes to learn and 10 minutes to play. For ages 8 and up.

On a player's turn, they shake up the bottle containing the 19 discs that are white (salt) on one side and black (pepper) on the other and then pour all them out calling out either Salt or Pepper.

They score 1 point for each token that came out on the side they called out. Those go back in the bottom while the others are set off to the side.

They repeat the process and may call out a different color with the remaining tokens. A player continues to do this until there are no more tokens in the bottle.

There are a few other special rules for outcomes based on what side of the tokens come out (all the same side, 7 or more of the same color. etc)

First player to 100 points win.

Name: Cheaters' Chili
Description:
Get ready to add some spice to your game night with Spicy Games! Each of the spice bottles hold all of the pieces you need to play a game. Each game takes 2 minutes to learn and 10 minutes to play.

Tokens are numbered 1 to 40. Each player received 4 random tokens and 10 chili pepper markers. At the beginning of the round, each player antes 1 pepper marker.

The start player will place a token face down and claim it is higher than X. Players can challenge or the next player may place one of their tokens face down saying it is higher than X (what the previous person claimed).

Instead of placing a token, you may challenge someone and place 2 of your pepper markers in the pot or you may challenge out of turn by placing 3 peppers. Reveal the card, if the player was lying the challenger receives all the peppers. if they were telling the truth, that player received the peppers. Players then redraw back to 4 tokens.

Play continues until one player is out of peppers and whoever has the most peppers at that time wins.

Name: Z First Impact: Opus 1 Chapter 2
Description:
In this second album First Impact Chapter 2 play as one of four members of the squadron urban scouts through these next 8 episodes. While avoiding zombies and mutants , you'll walk the streets in silence, climb on the roofs of buildings , drive a powerful vehicle customized or dare go down into the sewer ...

These are but, a few of the many actions that you can perform as a hero of Z First Impact. Will you to complete your shipment in hostile territory, despite the toxic attacks Boobers, the presence of pests on the roof, or the cries of howler ?

Play with four different characters each with unique characteristics in order to fullfill the missions objectives.

You may use an android or iPhone augmented free software instead of using dice and you will also have lots of visual and gaming effects.

Name: Eyegamer
Description:
Eyegamer — The Ultimate Board Game To Have Fun And Train Your Memory.

In Eyegamer, the goal of the game is simple. The player’s task is to collect as many pairs of cards as possible in the shortest period of time.  Eyegamer is a re-implementation of the classic memory game, with a minimalist, black & white card design.  The minimalist design of the cards is designed to make it harder for you to match cards.

At the start of the game, shuffle and place the entire 40 card deck in a 10x4 (4 rows of 10 cards each) layout.  The cards should be placed so that the patterned side of the cards are face down, and the "Eyegamer" card backs facing up.

On your turn, simply pick any two cards and turn them over, showing the patterned sides.  If they match, remove them from play.  Each matched set should stay with the player/team that matched them.  If the chosen cards do not match, flip them back so that the "Eyegamer" card backs are facing up.  They remain in play.

At the end of the game, each matched set is worth 1 point.  The player/team with the most points wins the game.

There are three modes of play included in the game:


     Solo - a 1 player challenge
     Challenge - a 2 player challenge
     Team Deathmatch - Up to 8 players (team sizes of 2 and 4 per team) with team members alternating turns choosing cards.


You can also purchase multiple Eyegamer decks to create larger grids for the game, thus making the game more challenging.

Name: Třináctá komnata pro partnery
Description:
Extension for couples.

Same rules like original games with new questions emphasizes on partnership.

Name: Spirit Island: Expansion Playmat
Description:
See the World of Spirit Island as imagined in the folklore from the game creator. This Map lays out the entire Island in stunning full color with realistic landscapes. It includes Iconography for each Spirit's home on the island as well as a new section not included on the tiles in the core game. This expansion allows 5 or 6 players to join in on the game.

Note that for playing a 5-6 player game, you need both the playmat AND the additional player tokens found in the Spirit Island: Champions of the Dahan Token Pack or Spirit Island: Jagged Earth.  The cardboard versions of the 2 map tiles which expand the game to 5-6 players are also available in Spirit Island: Jagged Earth.

The 1st Edition Playmat is 24" x 28".
The 2nd Edition Playmat is 30" x 35".

Name: Heropath: Dragon Roar – Fire Light
Description:
"In dark times – in your hour of need – I shall return to you – that is my path."

These words were known to famous isolationists as the final prophecy left by the Wizard. To others, it was no more than a rumor or a fable told to little children. No one really believed the prophecy, until that night…when the cursed hour arrived; enemies appeared from every crevice of the city. Out of the darkness, bright colors flashed and the ground trembled… and suddenly Wizard appeared, and whispered under his breath: 
"Dance, you fools, dance all the way from here to hell… dance, but do not forget to whisper to the dragon along your way that the wizard is back – your time is over."

Expansion 2: The Wizard
1. In this expansion we added one more hero (in addition to the hero in expansion 1) + one more hero board and so we actually expanded the game to 6 participants!!
This intensifies the game experience and allows to the participants switch characters and refresh the game.
2. The arsenal of clothing and weapons has been expanded into accessories that are suitable for wizards.
3. The hero can throw battle dice which belong to specific magic and thus increasing the amount of dice which the hero can throw from 2 to 3-5.

        The main advantage of this expansion is the additional fighting options for the game. It adds colorfulness and interest to the game and increased the possibilities that the hero has. It includes extra new cards or magic such as: ILLUSION MIRROR which allows the hero to do more actions in his turn.
    


We also added 4 magic dice to improve the hero's power.

—description from the publisher

Name: Heropath: Dragon Roar – With Allies
Description:
"Now I shall haunt you, until you know the wrath of the flames, for this is my vengeance."

If the Giant was told one year ago where his life would take him, he would not have believed it… and no one would have even heard of the goblin-slaying Giant. The Giant was a peaceful farmer who was content with his life, he bothered no one, and no one bothered him. That all changed after that one cursed winter… when the goblin raid started from the Caves of Doom – it was that same night when the goblin's fury torched 1,000 straw huts, and the air was filled with fear. It was from that same fire and pain that a hero and a legend was formed, the Giant who stood against evil and returned the favor twice over.

Expansion 1: The Giant
1.    In this expansion we added one more hero and one more hero board which allows a total of 5 participants – which of course intensifies the game experience and allows more people to participate.
2.    In order to improve the game experience we added a team of sub-heroes called "Allies". Each hero can convince (by increasing his faith) an ally to join him to his journey. 

        The main advantage of this expansion is the variety it gives to the game.
    


Such as: new cards, new tactics, extra accessories and even extra enemies.
Also there are special "Allies" dice that improve significantly the hero performance. 
Beyond that – the hero does not fight alone anymore; he has a team of fighters who add interest to the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Living
Description:
The Living is a cooperative board game with heavy emphasis on story. You play as a small group of survivors trying to make it through the aftermath of the zombie apocalypse. Each turn have to hold off the living dead and scrounge for supplies. But you also have to make difficult story choices that will show a lot about the types of survivors you are.

The Living is playable right out of the box; the game will teach you the rules as you play, allowing you to focus on the story.

The game won prizes for best innovation and best board game at Fastaval 2018.

—description from the publisher

Name: You Are a Liar (or maybe not)
Description: Life is unpredictable - sometimes it's hard to tell the difference between truth and lies. Here is your chance to practice! In You Are a Liar players take turns being the reader and guesser. The guesser has to determine who is lying in the stories being told by the readers. There is always at least one liar in the group. Guess the most lies and win the game!

Name: Maximum Apocalypse: Kaiju Rising
Description:
When monolithic beasts rose from the oceans, our military tried to stop them.  As we killed them at great expense and destruction, more kept rising from the depths.  Our world is theirs now.  They roam the landscape as an ever present threat while the last of us scrounge on what’s left from our crumbled civilization.

Maximum Apocalypse: Kaiju Rising adds two new survivor characters, the Army Ranger and Scientist.  Each character comes with their own unique survivor deck of abilities and equipment cards.  The Scientist is clever and adaptable whereas the Army Ranger is an excellent sniper and crowd control character.  Finally, this expansion adds a new apocalypse deck of 30 cards with new missions and challenges as you face the largest monsters seen thus far.

—description from the publisher

Name: Maximum Apocalypse: Gothic Horrors
Description:
Gothic Horrors is a deluxe expansion for Maximum Apocalypse.

The supernatural is real. Unspeakable horrors await those who venture out at night. Vampires drain the life of their victims while cultists summon strange creatures.  We’re hoping that we can scrounge together enough supplies to survive without our minds snapping, but it is a heavy burden to bear.

Maximum Apocalypse: Gothic Horrors adds three new apocalyptic scenarios, Cthulhu, Vampires, and the Yokai. Face off against life draining vampires, ghouls and werewolves in a classic monster set or try and stop a bunch of cultists from summoning Cthulu or other unspeakable Lovecraftian horrors. Each apocalypse brings with it new gameplay mechanics such as the Insanity deck of phobias or the new night/day event deck.  This expansion also adds two new survivor characters, the Priest and Ronin.  Each character comes with their own unique survivor deck of abilities and equipment cards.  The Priest is a persistent believer in humanity who offers protection from unspeakable evils. The Ronin is a new close range combatant with dual purpose cards that change based on her combat stance.

—description from the publisher

Name: Im Himmel empfängt man die Krone der Belehrung
Description:
This is a very early German game, possibly 17th-18th century, and perhaps unique. The rules and the outcome from landing in various squares are certainly handwritten on the thick paper board. Differences in the shapes of the space numbers suggest  calligraphy rather than printing, with irregularities in the shapes of the spaces pointing to a hand-drawn board as well.

Like many early board games, its theme is moral improvement. The game title translates as: "In Heaven you will receive the Crown of Instruction".

In play, it is a typical spin-and-move along a 100-space track that spirals inward, with penalties and bonuses affecting various spaces along the way.

Name: Emprise
Description:
Emprise is an fast paced action economy combat card game that also doubles as a 52/54 card deck. By deploying troops and commissioning officers, your mission is to reinforce your position while repressing the enemies'. You will be forced into tense situations, sabotage your allies, rescue enemies, and sacrifice your own troops to win the battle.

The objective is to earn victories by having enough reinforcements played at the end of your turn. However, each reinforcement can also be used for hand management, strategy denial, assaulting enemies' reinforcements, or controlling gameplay.

Name: Disney Pixar Fanimation Game
Description:
Disney Pixar Fanimation is a Disney Pixar themed board game.  The board is customizable and consists of four interlocking board game sections that each have two unique sides.  These board can be set up with between 2-4 sections depending on how long you want the game to be.

Game-play consists of spinning a spinner to determine how many spaces you move.  You will land on a colored space that corresponds with three decks of cards.  The decks are "Pardner Up" (pick a partner, draw a card, then do as the card says), "Head 2 Head" (pick an opponent, draw a card, then do as the card says), or "Go Solo" (hand the card to the player to the left, and you do what the player reads).  If you successfully complete the card or win the challenge, you follow the bonus rule for the board game section that you are on.

The goal is to be the first player to the finish line.

Name: Color-In Kingdom
Description:
Color-In Kingdoms is a Roll-and-Write game designed for Gen  Can't 2017 where players are the lead architects trying to build a beautiful Province for the Royal Family, but, being hampered by the whims of that same family.

Each of the 4 Royal Family Dice represents the construction desire of that family member, the 1 Royal Duties Dice represents pressing duties family members must attend to, so removes them from the pool for that turn.

Victory Points (VP) will be awarded at the end of the game based on the scoring as outlined on the Construction sheet.

Name: Queen Wasp (fan expansion for Hive)
Description:
The Wasp moves one space around the Hive.
Or,instead of moving, it can use its special ability to sting any enemy piece that's not in a stack. The stung piece is immediately flipped and is unable to move, use its special power or be re-flipped for one turn. The Wasp cannot sting a piece that has just moved or flipped by your opponent.

Name: Firefly (fan expansion for Hive)
Description: The Firefly moves two spaces up on top of the Hive from the ground level. When on the Hive it moves one space until it drops down. It cannot move around the Hive at ground level.

Name: Dragonfly (fan expansion for Hive)
Description: The Dragonfly moves one space up onto the Hive. Once on top of the Hive it must then move onto any adjacent piece and continue moving in a straight line in the same direction until it drops back down to ground level at the end of the row.

Name: Scorpion (fan expansion for Hive)
Description:
The Scorpion moves exactly two spaces around the Hive. Additionally it suppresses any
adjacent enemy bug so that they aren't permitted to f lip (see the orange outlined black Fly),with the exception of the Shieldbug which is immune to the Scorpion's attack. When the Scorpion is covered its powers are disabled.

Name: Fly (fan expansion for Hive)
Description:
The Fly can fly from any position to land on any bug that that your opponent placed.moved or f lipped on
their last turn. This includes bugs on top of a stack. It then
moves one space down into
an empty adjacent space at ground level.

Name: Centipede (fan expansion for Hive)
Description:
The Centipede moves three spaces on top of the Hive and must end its turn on another piece which isn 't in a stack.The piece which the Centipede finishes on then swaps places with the Centipede's original position

The one Hive rule must always be upheld; the Hive must not be broken. even whilst swapping the two pieces.

Name: Shieldbug (fan expansion for Hive)
Description:
The Shieldbug moves two spaces. one up onto the Hive then one down to end its turn on the ground level. It cannot be moved , flipped or removed from the Hive by any enemy piece. nor by any friendly piece it is touching.
When the Shieldbug is covered its powers are disabled.

Name: Tick (fan expansion for Hive)
Description:
The Tick alternates between moving one space up onto the Hive followed by one space back down again on the following turn. It cannot move along on top of the Hive. Or. it can use its special ability: Mind Control.
This allows the Tick to take control
of any enemy piece it is adjacent to at the same level of the Hive. It make the enemy piece use its own special
ability,e.g another piece, or move the enemy piece
using using the piece's own movement.

The Shieldbug moves two spaces. one up onto the Hive then one down to end its turn
 use its special ability: Mind Control.
This allows the Tick to take control
of any enemy piece it is adjacent to at the same level of the Hive. It make the enemy piece use its own special
ability,e.g another piece, or move the enemy piece
using using the piece's own movement.

Name: Assassin Bug (fan expansion for Hive)
Description:
The Assassin bug moves one space around the Hive. Or, instead it can use its special ability to remove an adjacent  enemy  piece that's not in a stack. To do this it moves on top of the enemy  piece permanently removing both the enemy piece and the Assassin bug from the game. The Assassin
bug cannot remove a piece your opponent has just moved or flipped.

Name: Praying Mantis (fan expansion for Hive)
Description:
The Mantis cannot ordinarily move.
piece on their last turn then the Mantis
can fly onto and remove tht piece. Both 
the Mantis  and the enemy  piece are then
permanently removed from the game.

Name: Butterfly (fan expansion for Hive)
Description: The Butterfly moves two spaces on top of the Hive but cannot move down off the Hive.

Name: Moth (fan expansion for Hive)
Description:
The Moth moves two spaces. One space down from on top of the Hive to ground level, then one space back up to finish on top of the Hive.
NB: The Mosquito can only mimic the movements of the Butterfly or Moth when adjac ent to either piece on top of the Hive and not at ground level since they don't begin their movement there.

Name: Cockroach (fan expansion for Hive)
Description: The Cockroach moves like the Ladybug, first on top of the Hive, and then one space down to ground level. The Cockroach must move onto the Hive as its first movement, and must move onto ground level for its final movement, however, its total movement on the hive is not restricted, except that it cannot move over pieces belonging to the opponent. The Cockroach is on the same tile as the Ladybug.

Name: Stick-bug (fan expansion for Hive)
Description:
May move either by rotating (pivoting keeping one end in place) OR
By moving the whole unit so one of its edges would have touched itself in its previous position
Can not land on units, but can land in confined spaces with half  (or more) of itself inside
Can pick it up with rotating or moving (so fit through is not an issue, but can’t unlink the hive)

Name: Flea (fan expansion for Hive)
Description:
Must be placed touching a piece of yours and one of your opponent’s
May hop (like a hopper) over 1 (only) in a straight line OR
May move 1, but must fit through

Name: The Earthworm (fan expansion for Hive)
Description: The Earthworm moves 3 spaces under the hive and swaps the position with the target bug

Name: Earwig (fan expansion for Hive)
Description: The earwig moves like a queen bee and then a grasshopper or vice-versa.

Name: Corsair Leader: Aces Expansion Pack
Description:
Get 56 Pilot cards of legendary US Navy and US Marine Pilots to add to your Squadrons!

—description from the publisher

Name: Small Star Empires: The Galactic Divide
Description:
After decades of colonization, the spacefaring races have finally come to the moment where even their own colonized space is not enough. Tensions are rising as each civilization tries to force its agenda upon the crowded galaxy and fortify its position.

When using Small Star Empires: The Galactic Divide, at the beginning of the game you choose which civilization to play with and take its corresponding civilization board. Each civilization board has unique abilities that cost certain amounts of power to play, and a track on which you mark the amount of power you have available. To increase your power, you must build massive battle stations on strategic locations adjacent to other players. Battle stations also protect your adjacent systems, disabling the other players from using special abilities on your territories.

Will you accept planets into your Tollaran Republic to build a mighty galactic federation, conquer the galaxy under your Hantal'ar Empire, unite the planets under Ora'Nor, or buy the most powerful galactic corporations as the Pern Conglomerate?

Name: SPAT
Description:
SPAT is a game of speed and accuracy for 2, 3, 4 or 5 players. Everybody plays at the same time and tries to get rid of their cards by playing them onto the shared SPAT piles by matching 2 of the 3 characteristics of the top card on the pile.

SPAT comes with a deck of 64 cards where each card has a number of animals in one of 4 backgrounds (For example: four pandas in line paper). 
All players set up their base like solitaire and play cards onto common discard piles (called SPAT piles).

The object of the game is to get rid of your cards as quickly as possible.

NOTE: this is NOT a turn-based game! All players compete in real-time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game – Expansion 2-2: New Challenger
Description: 5 custom character cards and a purple meeple that expands the game to 5 players.

Name: Joe Connaissant: Gars vs Filles
Description: A trivia game where the more you know, the more you score points. Each team has 2 minutes to anwser the most question possible. The less clues you get, the more point you gain. Each time you pass a card, you lose one point though.

Name: Lords of Hellas: Nemesis Promo Adrestia
Description: A promotional expansion for Lords of Hellas, consisting of one figure from Nemesis (adult invader) and 3 cards for use as an additional monster.

Name: Drecksau To Go
Description:
Only a dirty pig is a happy pig!

In Drecksau, each player has 3-5 clean pigs in front of him and three cards in hand. Each turn one card is played. By playing a mud card, one pig can be sent into the mud. The pig card is flipped over to show a dirty pig on the back. Rain cards clean all pigs, even your own! Barn cards protect pigs from the rain, while lightning cards destroy barns – but lightning rod cards protect barns from lightning cards. Farmer cards can be sent to dirty pigs: the farmer likes clean pigs... Pigs in a barn that are protected with a lock card are safe from the farmer. The first player who has dirtied all of his pigs wins!

Drecksau To Go includes both the Drecksau base game and the Sauschön expansion that lets players decide how they want to participate in the pig parade, whether with full makeup and styling fit for a beauty pageant or a more traditional wallow in the mud.

Name: Fussball Duell
Description: Using tactics cards, players in Fussball Duell move their players on the field, aiming to score a goal. Each team in turn plays a tactic card from their hand — dribbling, passing, freewheeling — to move their pieces on the field as well as the ball. Get close to the goal, then shoot! The game includes fouls and yellow cards for those who want to add more authenticity to their efforts.

Name: Werewolves of the Black Forest
Description:
As mayor of a tiny village in the Black Forest your aim is to make your village the most populous in the best housing and to keep it safe from the ravenous werewolf population, all while quietly working towards your secret objective.

A deckbuilding game for 2-4 players with a card settling mechanic that allows cards to provide different benefits depending on if you put the card in play or leave it in your deck for future turns.

Name: Coldwater Crown: The Sea
Description:
"The sea does not reward those who are too anxious, too greedy or too impatient." - Anne Morrow Lindbergh

In Coldwater Crown: The Sea, you may use a Port action to go to Sea in search of new, big, deep water fish. Sea fish are especially lucrative to catch and can be caught with any color of bait, but while at Sea you won't be able to catch fish from the Shore, Lake or River. How long will you choose to ride the open waves in search of Pollack, Red Sea Bream or the massive Blue Shark, knowing that every turn at Sea is a turn lost at the mainland? Patience, planning and a little bit of luck will help you find victory in this game-changing expansion to Coldwater Crown.

Coldwater Crown: The Sea adds five new species of fish, including one new wild-color Master Angler species, a beautifully illustrated Sea board and uniquely-scored Sea Challenge, one new turn option, four fishing vessels, one new type of fishing tackle, and expansion rules for solo-play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Western Legends: The Good, the Bad, and the Handsome
Description:
Historic characters from the American Wild West face off and write new legends across the face of history! Gather your gun, your mount, and your grit as you forge your path into the history books.

The Good the Bad and the Handsome, features three new legends with their corresponding goal cards, Unique Legendary Items, and even more story cards to add to the award-winning Western Legends.

Key Points
- Small Box expansion to the award-winning, Western Legends!
- Three new legends head west for players to choose from.
- All new Legendary Items included with even more story cards!

Name: Western Legends: Fistful of Extras
Description:
Historic characters from the American Wild West face off and write new legends across the face of history! Gather your gun, your mount, and your grit as you forge your path into the history books.

Fist Full of Extras is a Limited Quantity Expansion to the award-winning Western Legends. An open-world sandbox tabletop adventure for 2-6 players set in the American Wild West, this expansion contains all the unlocked stretch goal content from the 2018 Kickstarter and adds 6 new characters, new character minis, more items, story cards and more!

Key Points:
- Stretch goal expansion to the award-winning, Western Legends!
- Six new legends head west for players to choose from.
- New items and story cards increase the variety of options each game!

Name: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc – Unleash Hell
Description:
The Devil is a mixture of awesome and terrifying, with a large helping of run-for-your-lives thrown in for good measure. He is a very large “miniature”, falling into the rare class of Gigantic Creatures.
But you will get not only  the Devil, but also 3 bases of demonic Legion, another big farmhouse, ruin miniatures, a selection of tiles for flying and destroyed areas, some special GC dice, stat cards, and a scenario book. 
   Naturally the Devil fills an entire hex, and as he needs to empty a new one before he can move into it, he’s great at destroying terrain and smashing aside whatever stands in his way. This is done with the special GC dice that have some different results from normal combat dice, including the entertainingly titled STOMP! More importantly, each of these results applies to all units in an area, instead of being allocated to individual units like normal combat. We’ll get to combat in its own update. Suffice to say here that the Devil excels at killing everything.
    When it comes to taking hits, all Gigantic Creatures suffer damage like multi-wound heroes. This means that a result that would kill a normal man will only remove 1 wound. And the Devil has 10. And he can only lose a maximum of 3 per turn. And that’s after he ignores the first one because he gets an automatic shield result every time he is attacked.
Families: Game: Time of Legends – Joan of Arc

Name: Syphilitic Conquistadors
Description:
Join the invading Spaniards in the search for ancient treasure, or help the Aztecs protect their hidden storehouse, all while staving off the devastatingly crippling disease the Spaniards brought with them. 
This two player game pits players against each other on a small tiled map, where they must fight to take and keep control of Aztec gold.

—description from the publisher

Name: Machines of War
Description:
Machines of War is a military strategy game, using the elements of area-control and deck-building. As you build your machine (deck), you must strive to overpower your enemies, decimate their armies, take their lands, and conquer the city.

—description from the publisher

Name: Metropolis
Description:
Theme
Each player assumes the role of a property tycoon, with the objective of amassing the largest portfolio of iconic buildings, golf courses and luxury toys from around the globe.

Gameplay
Players choose a character figurine and begin at the start space, each player receives 7 resource cards, starting cash, a notepad and a player-sheet. Upon rolling the dice the first player then moves clockwise around the board, either landing on an asset, risk or deal space, they have the option to purchase the asset if they hold the required resource cards, or take a risk or deal card from the appropriate pile. A pre-selected banker controls the flow of cash for transactions and income which is received upon passing start.

If players land on an opponent's asset they must pay the indicated rent to the owner, inability to pay forces them to leave the game.

The play continues until one person is either declared the winner or all other players are eliminated due to running out of money.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pummeleinhorn: Die fiesen Keksdiebe
Description: Pummeleinhorn: Die fiesen Keksdiebe is a game based on Werewolf, but with subject matter friendlier for younger audiences, that accommodates from one to four half-dozen people.

Name: Kinder-Rommé: Bauernhoftiere
Description: Kinder-Rommé: Bauernhoftiere is a rummy game.

Name: Sei kein Frosch
Description: Sei kein Frosch exhorts you not to be a frog if you can help it.

Name: Polar Party
Description:
When the parents are not there, the little penguins launch a "Polar Party"! As they slide on the icebergs, they go fishing for fish, their favourite treat. But beware of the killer whale that roams and steals fish! And, most important of all, they have to be in their pyjamas and asleep when their parents come home from their dinner...

Every turn roll the dice to get some fish! The hardest part? Deciding whether to continue or go to bed!

Welcome to a special sleepover!

Name: Jewelers Row
Description:
Jewelers Row is a new Button Shy Wallet game in the limited "Select" Line. Consisting of only 18 cards, a rulebook and bi-fold wallet, Jewelers Row brings the excitement of app-inspired "Match-3" gameplay to your tabletop.

Deep beneath the street of Jewelers Row, gnomish gem crafters forge intricate pieces coveted throughout the realm. As one of these gnomish craftsmen, you will specialize in two prized gem types. Be careful not to use too many of the same gem in one piece, or customers will question their authenticity. You can always shift the blame to your competition, though; they’re certainly doing the same to you…

Players will each take turns placing cards containing a grouping of gems next to, or on top of other gem cards, hopefully scoring points on each placement. Points are scored when 3 or 4 of the same gem type align, but if you reach 5 or more of the same, you will start to lose points. Losing points isn't always a bad thing in Jewelers Row, however, as just before you score you will send the points in your lowest scoring gem color to your neighbor. Players then score for their top two gems, and only those two.

As you try to maximize your highest two gem types, you will want to watch your neighbor on your left to try to knock them down a notch, and watch the neighbor on your right to see the damage they're sending your way.

—description from the publisher

Name: Small Star Empires: Dawn of Discoveries
Description:
After decades of geological tests done on a remote research station deep in Tollaran space, scientists stumbled upon amazing discovery. They found that the rare crystals they were studying have enormous amount of energy, unlike anything they've seen before. The discovery of these crystals led the galaxy to a new era of technological breakthroughs, as it was already going through exciting and turbulent times since the start of the first major intergalactic conflicts.

When using Small Star Empires: Dawn of Discoveries, at the start of the game you randomly draw crystals of three colors from the bag and place one at each 1 planet system on the board. Additionally, you shuffle the technology deck and reveal several technology cards that will be available for the players to research (purchase).

Once you colonize a system containing a crystal, you collect that crystal. During the game you may spend collected crystals in order to research the available technologies. Additionally, you may also build research stations on the board. When an opponent colonizes a system adjacent to your research station, you both get "research bonus" and gain one extra crystal for use.

The technologies that you will research range from new engine drives that enable special movement across the board, utility modules that can be used to colonize asteroids and weapons, and shields that can be used to defend or damage ships. Eventually the technologies could score points at the end of the game, so you need to think about which technologies fit your strategy best!

How will you use the possibilities that the powerful crystals have to offer? Will you use the them to engage in researching peaceful technologies to further prosper your civilization or engage in military research in order to subdue the other civilizations?

Name: Mêlée, the Medieval Combat Card Game
Description:
Mêlée is a maneuver and fight, dice-less card game of medieval hand-to-hand combat.  The game is for two or more players.  It recreates combat with playing cards that represent individual warriors and warhorses.  In game play, Mêlée is like a traditional miniatures game, except that it uses cards rather than miniatures -- i.e., a miniatures game without the miniatures -- making it very affordable.  Multiple sets of decks are being manufactured, allowing it to serve as a collectible.

Battles are fought on a table top, upon an imagined grid of card-sized columns and ranks.  Alternatively, players may either create their own or purchase a large scale roll up play mat so that spacing is more visually apparent, though this is not required by any means.

The game is designed for simplicity and ease of play.  It is challenging and enables fast-paced play in 30 minutes or less, even when there are 50 warriors or more on each side.  The biggest limitation is the size of the gaming table available, rather than the cost or availability of armies of warrior cards.

The game designer's goal was to make a medieval combat game that cuts out the many complexities that often bog down miniatures combat games.  Instead, the focus was on rendering a more historically realistic experience on the battlefield with colorful and unique coats of arms carried by each warrior, as depicted in large size on the cards.  Launched through Kickstarter, the first sets of the game had cards that were sponsored by individual backers whose names and coats of arms appeared on each warrior card.

While most miniatures and fighting/combat games use various forms of hit points, unit points, and strengths, and these are slowly degraded in various engagements with dice rolling, routing, critical hits, and so forth, Mêlée is different.  There is no extensive paperwork and unit tracking round by round.  There are no chits or markers to indicate wounded warriors or degraded units -- warriors are either alive and fighting, or are killed.

The game depicts small, medium, or large-sized battles, but focuses combat right down to the individual level. Its combat methodology is drawn from the actual experience of the designer (and play testers) in medieval reenactment battles, where an individual fighter is generally doing fine, fighting away, moving, charging to engage, and so forth, but then at some critical moment in the battle, quite suddenly, he or she gets out too much in front or ends up on the flank with opposing forces circling around....  Things happen quickly from there -- and WHAM, WHAM, WHACK, they're down. Mêlée captures that experience perfectly.

In Mêlée, to be defeated, an individual warrior almost universally is first overwhelmed and is simultaneously hit by multiple attacks at once.  For instance, the warrior is attacked by a pole axe, two spears, a great sword, and someone with big mace hitting from the side, and, in that case, no amount of fancy footwork can save the day.  Thus, the key to victory is to maneuver your forces and focus your attacks selectively, maintaining a mobile reserve and carefully planning when, where, and how to engage.

The game's combat methodology is easy to learn, quick to grasp, and fast to play.  The rules are one sheet -- front and back -- and can be explained in a few minutes to almost anyone.  Combat is resolved simply by comparing "Combat Values" on cards.  Generally, if the Combat Values of the combined attacking cards add up to a value of TWICE the defending card's Combat Value, the defender is killed and removed from play.  While simple in practice, skilled players find that there are multiple dimensions of complexity that result.  A unique set of modifiers also are applied based on the four medieval elements -- Fire, Air, Earth, and Water -- as each of these represent combat styles that are chosen and employed in by each player during each combat round.

To win, either the majority of the opposing forces are defeated -- and the other side gives up, seeing no possible victory -- or the opposing side's banner is seized, which brings and early and glorious end to the battle.

Players may also make up their own victory conditions, such as escaping off the field with more than half of the remaining forces when the game is started with vastly unequal sides, or killing the opposing side's Commander, and so forth.

Scenario Packs and Add-On Expansion Card sets are also available, although the basic game provides extensive replayability as it is.

—description from the publisher

Name: Witchland
Description:
A terrible prophecy said that terrible monsters would bring darkness to the world at the align of the planets. Despite all the efforts to prevent it, the monsters manage to scaped to our realm and transformed the pacate village of Ashwood into the lands of Witchland. Rumors of the Witchland reached the ears of the Hallowhood Guild, an ancient guild of monster hunters who had for generations fought dark forces in various corners of the world. Over the centuries, fighting monsters became no longer just a chore, but also Hallowhood's greatest pastime and its members eagerly awaited an opportunity like this to prove themselves!

Witchland is a semi-cooperative game. Players must work together to find the terrible monsters that are ravaging Ashwood village and defeat them before the planets line up, but at the same time compete with each other to see who will be the great hunter of this adventure.

At the end of the game, if players succeed in their mission, the player with the most victory points will be the winner. When the planets align, the players failed to protect the world from shadow monsters and now no bet matters anymore. Perishing in darkness is all that remains for humanity.

Teamwork is critical to group victory, overly selfish actions or incorrect decisions can lead to everyone's defeat! But remember: there can be only one winner!

During the game, play as one of the Hallowhood members and look for clues to identify the whereabouts of terrible monsters
while dealing with a horde of angry peasants. To do this, collect ingredients, make potions and acquire powerful artifacts that will help you through this nightmare. Make the right choices when dealing with countless crossroads along your journey and remember: the enemy is always on the prowl.

—description from the designer

Name: Ardor: Bending Time
Description:
We believe in LOVE
But love, without communication, is incomplete.
Expressing what you like from your sex life is sometimes more difficult than saying "I love you!"
To enable communication so you can enjoy LOVE, we made Ardor.
By a couple. For couples.

Ardor - Bending Time is a card game for couples (and very close friends). For 2-4 players, +18. 
Designed to inspire you, 135 cards contain 60 activities and 35 sex positions selected to encourage exploration and discovery.

It has two parts:
"Part 1":
 Use strategy to compete for points in a trick and draw card game.

Follow the suits and the points to win cards. 
Perform small activities during this part to increase your chances of winning the game. 
The player with most points wins the ARDOR prize card and leads the next part.

"Part 2" : Build decks with the cards won. 
Draw from the deck and decide if you will Enhance or Level-up the activity before performing it.

Activities can be Enhanced, by introducing toys, or other accessories, to them.
They can also be Leveled-Up, adding a twist to the whole activity.

—description from the publisher

Name: 朧ニンジャスタートリック (Oboro Ninja Star Trick)
Splatto
Description:
Splatto is a family game in which players have to be the first to have their "meeple" exit the track.

The game design takes a lot of influence from cross and circle games such as Ludo with a few notable differencies.

First of all, the game starts with every players creating their token in modeling clay. The most creative one get to be the first player.

At their turns, the players draw a card with 2 movement options and move their tokens to the next applicable case. Some special cards allow to splat other players tockens and making the case not usable animore. This speeds up the game considerabely as the reach of tokens increase significantly the least case are valid for moevement.

Name: Tipsy Land
Description:
The object of the game is to the first to get to the end of the path.

Each player rolls the die and advances one’s own pawn indicated. Along the way players take a drink or force others to take a drink depending on which space a player’s pawn lands. The rules say, “Recommended to be played with non alcoholic beverages” but included with the game are four shot glasses. The instructions are in English, Spanish, and French so the publisher is duplicitous in three languages. Also of note, the game board is made of glass.

Name: Bleaktrick
Description:
Bleaktrick is a trick-taking game for 3 or 4 players that can be played with a standard deck of playing cards. 40 cards are used: Aces to 10's in each of the four suits. At the start of each round, 36 of the 40 cards are dealt equally to the players and each player exchange one card face-down with both of its neighbors. In a 3-player game, each player also discards a card from his hand.

The dealer leads the first trick and play proceed clockwise until all cards are played. Normal rules for trick-taking games apply: players must follow suit, otherwise they can play any card and the highest card of the leading suit wins the trick (there is no trump suit). When a player wins a trick,
he takes only the card that won the trick (the rest of the trick is discarded), puts it in his winning pile and leads the next trick.

The twist in Bleacktrick game is this: Every time a player takes a trick with a card of equal or lower value than a certain threshold, then this card becomes the "bleak" card. The starting value of the threshold is 7 but it changes each time to match the value of the last "bleak" card. There's an exception though: if you are already the "bleak" card owner, you can win tricks with cards of smaller value without lowering the threshold. The goal of the game is to score the most points without ending up with the "bleak" card in your possession.

At the end of the round, each player scores points according to the cards in his winning pile, except from the "bleak" card owner who scores negative points. The lower the numerical value of a card, the more points it scores (for both the positive and the negative case). So, it's preferable to win tricks with low value cards but also more risky as you may end up with the "bleak" card. The player who won the last trick is the dealer for the next round, while the owner of the "bleak" card can have a peek at 2 of the 4 unused cards of the next round. The game ends after a prearranged number of rounds or when a player reaches a prearranged number of points.

—description from the publisher

Name: Disney Presents Movie Classics VCR Board Game
Description:
Remember Snow White, Pinocchio, and Cinderella? Their adventures enchanted you when you were a child. Now with the Disney Movie Classics VCR board game, your child meets the same delightful characters but in a whole new way!  Actual footage from the Disney movies is combined with three fun matching games.

Just insert the tape into your VCR and the adventure begins! The tape tells the story while the games add extra fun and excitement!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Diskmagik
Description:
Diskmagik is an advanced version of the game Diskmoon, based on the novels universe "Ge-Volver 1810" by author Marco Ricchini.
In this uchronic XIX century, different ancient races live in secret among humans, often holding important roles in many nations.
Some of these people have the power of the ancient two-faced god Janus, this grants them two different appareances in one body.

In Diskmagic, a pirate called Morgan the Obese wrote a ruleset to regularize the rough sport invented by his crew and called it the Diskmoon discipline.
He dictated that all the games would have been played at Skull Island and the item to retrieve would be an ancient preciuos coin, called Diskmoon.

In the Diskmoon game series, two players use a team of four miniatures of different races. The two teams start the game in two different sides of the game board, comprised of 17x17 squares that they will build using two-sided tiles, making a different game every time.
The purpose of the game is to find the Diskmagik token and bring it to the opponent starting side to score one point. The first player that scores two points wins the game. One team can also win the game if he kills all the opponent's Jollary characters.
The players activate one of their miniatures every turn. Each miniature has 10 action points to spend for movement, attack, passing the diskmagik and using special abilities.
Each character also has two different sides represented on the miniature and on the cards than represent the two forms that he can switch into during the game to change his abilities and statistics.
The game board has some obstacles like water and lava that can slow or kill some characters.

Diskmagik reimplements the game Diskmoon introducing "the swarm" mechanic.

Name: Diskfightorient
Description:
Diskfightorient is an advanced version of the game Diskmoon, based on the novels universe "Ge-Volver 1810" by author Marco Ricchini.
In this uchronic XIX century, different ancient races live in secret among humans, often holding important roles in many nations.
Some of these people have the power of the ancient two-faced god Janus, this grants them two different appareances in one body.

In Diskfightorient, a pirate called Morgan the Obese wrote a ruleset to regularize the rough sport invented by his crew and called it the Diskmoon discipline.
He dictated that all the games would have been played at Skull Island and the item to retrieve would be an ancient preciuos coin, called Diskmoon.

In the Diskmoon game series, two players use a team of four miniatures of different races. The two teams start the game in two different sides of the game board, comprised of 17x17 squares that they will build using two-sided tiles, making a different game every time.
The purpose of the game is to find the Diskmoon token and bring it to the opponent starting side to score one point. The first player that scores two points wins the game. One team can also win the game if he kills all the opponent's Jollary characters.
The players activate one of their miniatures every turn. Each miniature has 10 action points to spend for movement, attack, passing the diskmagik and using special abilities.
Some characters also has two different sides represented on the miniature and on the cards than represent the two forms that he can switch into during the game to change his abilities and statistics.
The game board has some obstacles like water and lava that can slow or kill some characters.

Diskmagik reimplements the game Diskmoon introducing "grenades" mechanic.

Name: Santa's Game
Description:
Santa’s Game is a card game with Christmas theme and a variety of Christmas characters. It is based on Czech version of public domain card game Crazy Eights (“Prší”). Santa’s Game introduces new rules and additional cards. Although the theme is Christmas oriented, the game is wonderful to be played at any time during the whole year.

It is quick and easy to learn, yet can be more fun and strategic than appears on a first sight. Being in a category of games based on random draw, clever strategy can sometimes eliminate randomness a lot.

Game contains 110 cards and rules.

Cards are divided into 5 suits, 22 cards per suit. There are four suits of colored cards (red, green, blue, yellow) and one suit of special cards (grey). Colored cards are: Reindeer/Number 1 to 9 (72 cards), Gift (8 cards), Christmas Tree (8 cards). Special cards are: Santa Claus (8 cards), Santa’s Sleigh (8 cards), Snowman (4 cards), Elf (2 cards).

At the beginning of the round, each player receives 7 cards. The goal is to get rid of all the cards in player’s hand by matching last played card on a discard pile.

Player’s turns are taken in a clockwise direction. A player can make only one action during each turn. An action is considered to discard a card, to take a card from the deck, to pass the penalty and to take penalty cards. Each turn player discards only one card to a discard pile (with the exception of Santa's Sleigh, where is player allowed to discard multiple cards). Each card has a function, which is executed after player discards it.

Based on a card on a discard pile, player can only discard the same color (red, blue, green and yellow) or the same value of the cards (same number, Gift, Tree). Special cards (grey) may be discarded over any card, except if player is receiving penalty. If player does not want or cannot discard any card, they must take one card from the deck.

Cards:

Reindeer – represents numbers 1 to 9
Gift – any chosen player at the table gets 2 penalty cards
Christmas Tree – the next player’s turn is skipped
Santa Claus – changes color
Santa’s Sleigh – discards more Reindeer at the same time
Snowman – passes the penalty to next player in the sequence
Elf – returns player to the game

—description from the publisher

Name: Lunker
Description:
Fishing game where players attempt to catch the most bass as measured in total weight.  Players move from area to areas on the board and cast lines in an attempt to reel in a fish.  Dice rolls determine whether you caught anything (with some areas providing a higher probability of success) and the size of the bass that was caught.  There are penalties for catching undersized fish or returning to the marina too late at the end of the game.

From the front of the box:


Designed by fishermen for fishermen... Ages 8 to 80. Three levels of play: BASIC * INTERMEDIATE * ADVANCED teach scientific fishing by simulating actual fishing experiences. YOUR fishing knowledge and skill determine YOUR catch. Perfect for family, club, or solitary play. 1-8 PLAYERS.

Name: First Class: Call for Tenders
Description:
Included in the Deutscher Spielepreis 2017 Goodie Box

Contains six tender tokens and two markers for each player. Tenders are a one time bonus available for each player. Each token has two different requirements and a player fulfilling either will get the reward. First player gets an additional bonus, afterwards the token is flipped and the rest of the players will get a lesser reward. At the end of round the lowest numbered tender will be removed from the game.

Name: Kritzeln
Description: Kritzeln is a drawing game of some sort, with players needing to connect every dot in the grid as they draw figures.

Name: Major League Baseball Challenge Game
Description:
The Major League Baseball Challenge game is personalized to each team in Major League baseball.  The box covers are designed for each team as well as a playing board which duplicates the home teams ball park, all in full color. No dice involved, this is a card game with special "at bat" and "fielding" cards which control play and provide real life baseball action. The rules are simple and the game is fast with sudden reversals like a home run with two on in the bottom of the 9th inning, for a come from behind win. Good Luck and "Play Ball."

—description from the back of the box

Name: Gone in 61 Seconds
Description:
You've been boosting cars ever since you were a little kid. It was the "family business," so to speak. So, when you and your cronies stumble across a parking lot full of luxury, heavily modified rally cars, there is no freaking way you can pass up such a tasty cherry just waiting to be plucked. But, to steal them all, and not end up doing a nickel in the big house, you know you must be... gone in 61 seconds.

How To Play
Shuffle and arrange the "Car" and "Security Guard" cards in a 4x8 grid, face up on the playing surface. This is the "Parking Lot." Security Guards face the most expensive car between those in front of and behind it. Place the rest of the deck face down. The player to the left of the dealer has first turn.

For each turn a player draws 1 card and replaces a card in the Parking Lot with it, keeping the card removed. "Forward" cards replace any unblocked card to steal it by driving it away in forward gear. "Reverse" cards allow the opposite action. "Plus" cards steal a car in either direction and give the player an extra turn. Blank cards cover Security Guards to remove them. If a card can't be played, place it at the bottom of the deck and skip the turn. A turn ends when the drawn card is played.

A car cannot be stolen if another car or Security Guard is blocking the path out of the lot, or if the guard's flashlight is pointed directly at it. The game ends when all cards have been stolen.

The player who has stolen the greatest value of cars after all have been boosted, wins!

Name: Ascension: Ultimate Collector's Edition
Description:
The Ultimate Collector's Edition was exclusively available from the Ascension Online kickstarter.  Only 150 copies were produced.

This edition contains the contents of the Ascension: Year One and Year Two Collector's Editions (excluding the Year Two gameboard).

It's standout features are the stunning wooden box, with metal clasp and corners, and and the signed certificate of authenticity.

Name: Monster Meister
Description:
Yellow and three-eyed??? Help!!!

If you bring many of the right monsters into the light of day, you can chase the creepy creatures away from your own front yard. But soon, the monstrous memory aids rush to help the players with weaker memory skills! Monster Meister is a curious memory spectacle in which memory gaps can successfully be closed with more and more new monsters.

Each player has a set of 16 monsters. The cards are shuffled and arranged in a 4x4 cards grid face down. Now a task will be revealed, i.e. face up 6 cards of your choice in your grid. Blue monsters will count 2 points while yellow ones count as -1 point. The player that counts the most points that round will loose one of his face up monster cards, while the player with the least points gets one roaming monster (from a pile) in addition. All monsters are flipped back face down. The next task will be revealed. Task after task you will learn which type of monster hides in which position in your grid. After ten task cards, the player with the least number of own monsters will win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation DVD Game
Description:
CSI DVD Screen Show Game lets you experience the intense drama of the popular CSI TV series with your friends and family; investigate evidence, interview suspects, and solve the case--all on your TV screen.

A casino lounge...a Las Vegas hotel...an autopsy room...

Enter the real world of CSI and uncover the powerful plots and terrific twists in this interactive, multi-player DVD game.

Remember to listen up, take notes and look carefully, because any clue could help you solve the murder mystery.

—description from the publisher
Families: TV Shows: CSI – Crime Scene Investigation
